result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Aaron Lee Michael Erickson in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Aaron Lee Michael Erickson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Ron Custer- sworn and testifies. Police officer with SPD. Executed search warrant 8/5/22. Defendant was present in residence. Found loaded syringe and burnt tinfoil in his room.Needle tested positive for meth. Witness identifies defendant.
Att Hoffman cross examines- Was another room that had Aaron and Mystique written on the wall. Found THC and pipes with burnt residue there.
State moves for bind over
Att Hoffman- Opposes bind over
Court finds probable cause for bind over. Sets date
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

2:05 PM Defendant Aaron Lee Michael Erickson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Reid in court for Aaron Lee Michael Erickson.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case.  Address verified. Court quashes warrant based on appearance, questions non appearance. Attorney Reid has no information. Defendant indicates was just running late. 
State requests $750 cash, conditions of no drugs. Cites prior FTA.
Attorney Reid indicates attempted to make appearance yesterday. Longtime resident of Douglas County. Asks for signature bond or lower cash. 
Court orders $100 cash, reinstatement of 1500 signature bond. Conditions of no use or possession of drugs or paraphernalia
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:29 AM Defendant Aaron Lee Michael Erickson not in court.  Attorney Ryan Ried in court for Aaron Lee Michael Erickson.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Reid has no information on non appearance of defendant.  Request adjournment.
State requests warrant based on non appearance. geographic-State of Wisconsin
Court issues warrant, forfeits bail/bond.

8:58 AM Defendant Aaron Lee Michael Erickson in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Aaron Lee Michael Erickson.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att Hoffman- On medical quarantine with COVID, requests reschedule.
Defendant waives time limits
Court accepts waiver, resets prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court orders 1500sb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
